{"step_by_step_thinking": "Jersey finger is a condition where the flexor digitorum profundus tendon is ruptured. This tendon is responsible for flexing the distal interphalangeal joint (DIP) of the finger. When the tendon is ruptured, the person is unable to flex the DIP joint. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Flexor digitorum profundus.", "answer_choice": "B"}
